item.description:
Welcome local permaculture designers, teachers and world travellers Charles & Julia Yelton home to Maine by joining them at their permaculture home and gardens in Whitefield, Maine (about 1h 15m from Portland). Charles & Julia have invited all who are interested to join them in seeing Humustacia (the name of their home), enjoying a potluck lunch and helping out a bit in reviving the gardens for the season. The Yeltons have been busy travelling and permaculturing:) in Australia, Sicily, the Bahamas and Cyprus since December and will have only just returned.

The site includes extensive permaculture gardens, several ponds, a passive solar home with integrated thermally massive greenhouse, a cool cupboard, humanure system and more. Although no has been living there for a few months, this remains one of the best examples of applied permaculture in Maine.

Help out in the gardens before lunch, after lunch or both.
10:00 arrival for morning work party session
1:00 break to share potluck lunch (bring your own potluck kit and a dish to share) and informal touring/Q&A about the site
3:00 start an afternoon work party session
5:00 wind down and depart

In addition to your potluck kit and a food item to share, bring work shoes/boots, gloves and clothes that can get a bit dirty.
